text: Vladimir Volfovich Zhirinovsky (Russian: Влади́мир Во́льфович Жирино́вский) (born Vladimir Volfovich Eidelstein; 25 April 1946 - 6 April 2022) was a Russian politician, lawyer and a colonel in the Soviet Army and later the Russian Army. ==Works== He was the founder and Leader of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia (LDPR). He was a member of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe.Diary: Campaign circus, BBC News, 20 November 2007Vladimir Zhirinovsky (Russian politician) – Britannica Online Encyclopedia. Zhironovsky was extremely racist'Racist Vladimir Zhirinovsky expressed hatred towards Caucasians' (YouTube, uploaded 22 June 2011 - Russian audio only)Russian Ultra-Nationalist Zhirinovsky's Anti-US 2002 Rant (YouTube, uploaded 29 March 2007 - Russian audio, English subtitles) and sexist.'Vladimir Zhirinovsky reveals the truth about women' (YouTube, uploaded 23 June 2013 - Russian with English subtitles)'Possibly the world’s vilest politician orders his men to “violently rape” pregnant journalist ', 5 May 2014 ==2021 speech== Zhirinovsky predicted in a speech on December 27 2021, the exact date when the Russian military invaded eastern Ukraine. He said "At 4 a.m. on February 22, you will feel [our new policy]. I would like 2022 to be a peaceful year. But I love the truth, for 70 years I have been telling the truth. It will not be peaceful. It will be a year when Russia becomes great again." ==Death== In February 2022, Zhirinovsky was hospitalized in Moscow with COVID-19. A month later, it was reported he was being treated for COVID- related problems such as sepsis and respiratory failure. Zhirinovsky died from problems caused by the virus on 6 April 2022, aged 75. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Soviet colonels Category:Russian lawyers Category:Russian military people Category:Members of the State Duma Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Moscow Category:Moscow State University alumni Category:Almaty Region
